remarks:
Define the image of a class (as restricted by another class). Definition 6.6(2) of [TakeutiZaring] p. 24.  For example, ` ( F = { <. 2 , 6 >. , <. 3 , 9 >. } /\ B = { 1 , 2 } ) ` ` -> ( F " B ) = { 6 } ` ( ~ ex-ima ).  Contrast with restriction ( ~ df-res ) and range ( ~ df-rn ).  For an alternate definition, see ~ dfima2 .  (Contributed by NM, 2-Aug-1994.) 

---

 Define the image of a class (as restricted by another class). Definition 6.6(2) of [TakeutiZaring] p. 24.  For example, ( F = { ` <. ` 2 , 6 ` >. ` , ` <. ` 3 , 9 ` >. ` } /\ B = { 1 , 2 } ) -> ( F ` " ` B ) = { 6 } .  Contrast with restriction ( ~ df-res ) and range ( ~ df-rn ).  For an alternate definition, see ~ dfima2 .  (Contributed by NM, 2-Aug-1994.)
statement: df-ima $p |- ( A " B ) = ran ( A |` B ) $.
